page.title: 16FARMING IN BIRCH
page.content: The{Birch Estate}consists of 2,000 acres and was formed by the amalgamation of six local farms. Of the{2,000 acres}1,800 acres are cultivated, the remainder being woodland and grassland. The following crops are grown:- 850 acres{winter wheat. 350 acres{winter barley. 150 acres{rye. 180 acres{potatoes. 150 acres{sugar beet. 100 acres{peas. 100 acres{rape. The land is farmed by 14 employees. Many hedges have been taken out to give larger fields. Except for Lukes Farm which contains the{Sheep Unit}no other animals are kept. Originally the 6 farms had their own herds of cattle and employed 64 people between them in the 1950's.
